dtwhaclustering.leastSquareModeling¶

Least square modeling of GPS displacements for seasonality, tidal, co-seismic jumps.

author

Utpal Kumar

date

2021/06

copyright

Copyright 2021 Institute of Earth Sciences, Academia Sinica.

leastSquareModeling.lsqmodeling(dUU, dNN, dEE, stnlocfile, plot_results=True, remove_trend=False, remove_seasonality=True, remove_jumps=False, sel_eq_file='helper_files/selected_eqs_new.txt', figdir='LSQOut')¶

Least square modeling for the three component time series

Parameters

  • dUU – Vertical component pandas dataframe time series

  • dNN – North component pandas dataframe time series

  • dEE – East component pandas dataframe time series

  • plot_results – plot the final results

  • remove_trend – return the time series after removing the linear trend

  • remove_seasonality – return the time series after removing the seasonal signals

  • remove_jumps – return the time series after removing the co-seismic jumps

  • sel_eq_file – File containing the earthquake origin times e.g., 2009,1,15 with header info, e.g. year_val,month_val,date_val

  • stnlocfile – File containing the station location info, e.g., DAWU,120.89004,22.34059, with header stn,lon,lat

Returns

Pandas dataframe corresponding to the vertical, north and east components e.g., final_dU, final_dN, final_dE

class leastSquareModeling.LSQmodules(dUU, sel_eq_file=None, station_loc_file='helper_files/stn_loc.txt', comp='U', figdir='LSQOut', periods=(13.6608, 14.7653, 27.5546, 182.62, 365.26, 18.6))¶
compute_lsq(plot_results=False, remove_trend=True, remove_seasonality=True, remove_jumps=True, plotformat=None)¶

Compute the least-squares model using multithreading

Parameters

  • plot_results – plot the final results

  • remove_trend – return the time series after removing the linear trend

  • remove_seasonality – return the time series after removing the seasonal signals

  • remove_jumps – return the time series after removing the co-seismic jumps

  • plotformat – plot format of the output figure, e.g. “png”. “pdf” by default.

jump(t, t0)¶

heaviside step function

Parameters

  • t – time data

  • t0 – earthquake origin time
